alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Furnas; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 24 at 11:24PM CDT until June 25 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR PHELPS...SOUTHWESTERN BUFFALO...GOSPER...SOUTHEASTERN DAWSON... FURNAS AND HARLAN COUNTIES... At 1123 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Overton to near Holdrege to near Long Island, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. In addition, a 63 MPH wind was measured at 1118 PM CDT by a weather station 6 miles west-northwest of Atlanta. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Holdrege and Ragan around 1130 PM CDT. Alma, Elm Creek and Funk around 1135 PM CDT. Odessa around 1140 PM CDT. Republican City around 1145 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 232 and 265. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
